Dinas Kesehatan NTT Siap Tangani Gizi Buruk
04 Nov 2019, 22:44 by Denisa Tristianty


Dinas Kesehatan NTT Siap Tangani Gizi Buruk

Jakarta, KBRN : Kepala Dinas Kesehatan Provinsi Nusa Tenggara Timur (NTT), Dominikus Mere memastikan penanganan gizi buruk akan lebih cepat dari sebelumnya.
“Saya sudah minta supaya segera laporkan, kalau ada peningkatan kasus untuk segera dilakukan intervensi sesuai protap. Penanganan kasus secara terorkoordinasi, kolaboratif dengan lintas sektor terkait,” kata Dominikus di Kupang, NTT seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, Senin (4/11/2019).
Dinas Kesehatan NTT, kata dia, sudah melakukan koordinasi dengan pihak terkait penanganan gizi buruk di sana. Antara lain, koordinasi itu dilakukan terhadap petugas kesehatan lingkungan, dan petugas penyakit menular. Mereka diajak mengamati untuk gizi buruk, malaria, ISPA, dan diare di NTT.
“Itu upaya pemerintah guna melakukan pencegahan terhadap serangan penyakit musim pancaroba. Dan penanganan gizi buruk di provinsi berbasis kepulauan itu untuk menghindari jatuhnya korban jiwa,”ungkap dia.
Dominikus juga menekankan, Pemerintah Provinsi NTT juga telah siap mengantisipasi segala macam kemungkinan terburuk. (FOTO/M Agung Rajasa/foc/18)
“Jadi, sepanjang daerah bisa menangani, tidak masalah. Tetapi, kalau sudah meluas, maka secepatnya dilaporkan untuk dilakukan penanganan secara bersama,”kata dia

NTT Health Office Ready to Handle Malnutrition
Nov 04 2019, 22:44 by Denisa Tristianty


NTT Health Office Ready to Handle Malnutrition

Jakarta, KBRN: Head of the East Nusa Tenggara Province (NTT) Health Office, Dominikus Mere, ensures that handling of malnutrition will be faster than before.
"I have asked to report immediately, if there is an increase in cases for immediate intervention according to procedures. The handling of cases in a coordinated, collaborative manner with related cross-sectors, "Dominikus said in Kupang, NTT as reported by the Antara News Agency, Monday (11/04/2019).
The NTT Health Office, he said, had coordinated with related parties handling malnutrition there. Among other things, the coordination was carried out for environmental health workers, and infectious disease officers. They were invited to observe for malnutrition, malaria, ARI, and diarrhea in NTT.
"That is the government's effort to prevent the attacks of the transition season disease. And the handling of malnutrition in the island-based province is to avoid casualties, "he said.
Dominikus also stressed that the NTT Provincial Government was also ready to anticipate all kinds of worst possibilities. (PHOTO / M Agung Rajasa / foc / 18)
"So, as long as the regions can handle it, it doesn't matter. But, if it has expanded, it will be reported as soon as possible to be handled jointly, "he said
